pkgmetadata.longdescription:
PCem (an acronym for Personal Computer emulator) is an open-source, low-level PC emulator developed for Windows and Linux by Sarah Walker.
It focuses on PC hardware from the 1980's and 1990's. A variety of operating systems can be installed in the emulator, which can then be used to launch programs.

use.flag: Enable support for emulation of network cards.
